titles: The witty maid of the vvest; or, The miller well thrash'd by Robin the plowman: for which service he received a sum of money, which bought a ring and paid for the marriage betwixt him and his beloved Nancy. Tune of, Ladies of London.
publisher: Printed for P. Brooksby, J. Deacon, J. Blare and J. Back.,
notes: Place and date of publication taken from Wing (2nd ed.)
Reproduction of original in: University of Glasgow. Library.
